newsitem.title: USA: Fed seen adding reserves via overnight system RPs.
newsitem.headline: Fed seen adding reserves via overnight system RPs.

text.p: The Federal Reserve is expected to add temporary reserves to the U.S. banking system on Wednesday via overnight system repurchase agreements, market analysts said.

"We're looking for an overnight system RP," said Dana Saporta, economist at Stone & McCarthy Research Associates Inc. "In the remaining eight days of the current reserve period we put the Fed's daily average add need at $5.8 billion."
Saporta said Tuesday's early intervention most likely resulted from a particularly large add-need for that day.
Analysts at Aubrey G. Lanston & Co Inc were also calling for overnight system RPs on Wednesday.
At 1100 EDT/1500 GMT, the federal funds rate was trading at 5-5/16 percent, slightly above the Fed's 5-1/4 percent target for the rate.
